title: 9 Easy Troubleshooting Steps to Fix the YouTube Offline Error

steps.title: Reloading the video's page often fixes the Offline problem.
steps.content: Reloading the video's page often fixes the Offline problem. To refresh the page in your web browser, you can either press F5 or click the refresh icon on the browser toolbar to refresh the page.

steps.title: Log out of your YouTube account, then log back in.
steps.content: Log out of your YouTube account, then log back in. Your current login may be stuck in a bug. Logging out and back in will force the system to reload and possibly get rid of the offline error!

steps.title: Delete the cache in Chrome, Edge, or your preferred browser.
steps.content: Delete the cache in Chrome, Edge, or your preferred browser. The steps to clear the cache vary by browser, but you can usually clear your data and cache history in Settings > History > Clear History .

steps.title: A quick DNS flush often clears up the YouTube Offline error.
steps.content: A quick DNS flush often clears up the YouTube Offline error. To do a DNS flush : Open Command Prompt as an administrator . Type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter . Try YouTube again.

steps.title: Disconnecting and reconnecting to Wi-Fi might do the trick.
steps.content: Disconnecting and reconnecting to Wi-Fi might do the trick. Click the Wi-Fi icon in your taskbar and disconnect from your current network, then reconnect after a few seconds to see if the YouTube Offline error goes away.

steps.title: Disconnecting and reconnecting your router can clear up many issues.
steps.content: Disconnecting and reconnecting your router can clear up many issues. To power cycle your router , unplug it from the wall for about 2 minutes, then plug it back in. Once you reconnect your PC to the network, reload your YouTube video to see if you're still seeing the Offline error.

steps.title: Low bandwidth can be your issue.
steps.content: Low bandwidth can be your issue. In some cases, public networks are limited in bandwidth, so it may seem like you have a solid internet connection on other sites while a larger bandwidth site like YouTube gives you an offline error. You also want to make sure that you don't accidentally have Airplane Mode enabled! Make sure the tile isn't colored in your taskbar. Use internet speed checkers to make sure you're getting the correct speed for what you're paying for.

steps.title: Your ad blocker may cause YouTube to think you're offline.
steps.content: Your ad blocker may cause YouTube to think you're offline. While ad blockers can be helpful by hiding intrusive and annoying ads, they can also sometimes block things that you want to see, like YouTube videos. The steps to disable ad blockers vary, but you can generally click the extension's icon to turn it off for the page you're currently viewing.

steps.title: Your VPN can also cause YouTube to give you an error.
steps.content: Your VPN can also cause YouTube to give you an error. To turn it off , you can edit the information in the "VPN" section of Network Settings. [1] X Research source
